  if (knitr::is_latex_output()) {
    sprintf("\\texttt{%s}", as.character(x))
  } else if (knitr::is_html_output()) {
    sprintf("<tt>%s</tt>", as.character(x))
  } else {
    x
  }
}

## Retrieve Data from `r tt("AoC")`


```{r get-data, cache = FALSE, messages = FALSE}
session_cookie <- set_cookies(session = keyring::key_get("AoC-GitHub-Cookie"))
base_url <- paste0("https://adventofcode.com/", params$year, "/day/", params$task_nr)
puzzle <- GET(base_url,
              session_cookie) %>% 
  content(encoding = "UTF-8") %>% 
  xml_find_all("///article") %>% 
  lapply(as.character)

parse_puzzle_data <- function(text_block = readClipboard()) {
  if (length(text_block) == 1L) {
    text_block <- text_block %>% 
      str_split("\n") %>% 
      extract2(1L) %>% 
      keep(nzchar)
  }
 res <- text_block %>% 
   str_extract_all("-?\\d+") %>% 
   do.call(rbind, .) %>% 
   set_colnames(letters[23:26])
 storage.mode(res) <- "integer"
 res
}

puzzle_data <- local({
  GET(paste0(base_url, "/input"),
      session_cookie) %>% 
    content(encoding = "UTF-8") %>% 
    parse_puzzle_data()
})
```

# Puzzle Day `r params$task_nr`

## Part 1

### Description

```{r show-puzzle-a, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
cat(puzzle[[1]])
```

### Solution

We solve this puzzle by calculating all pairwise distances between the fixed points and
then constructing a graph, where 2 points are connected iif their distance is less or 
equal 3. Then we simply have to count all components.

```{r get-solution-1, cache = TRUE}
construct_graph <- function(fixed_points = puzzle_data) {
  n <- seq_len(nrow(fixed_points))
  dis <- outer(n, n, \(i, j) rowSums(abs(fixed_points[i, ] - fixed_points[j, ])))
  e <- which(dis <= 3L & lower.tri(dis), arr.ind = TRUE)
  G <- graph_from_edgelist(e, FALSE)
  components(G)$no
}
construct_graph(puzzle_data)
```
